source.f23d35f4:
#importing libraries
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.4894c845:
#Reading csv file
store=pd.read_csv("../input/sample-supermarket-dataset/SampleSuperstore.csv", sep=",", encoding="ISO-8859-1", header=0)
store.head()
source.18abda80:
#checking null values in the data set 
store.isnull().sum()
source.086c0dc5:
#State
plt.figure(figsize=(30,18))
ed=sns.countplot(x="State", data=store)
ed.set_xticklabels(ed.get_xticklabels(),rotation=90)
plt.xticks(fontsize=30)
plt.yticks(fontsize=30)
plt.xlabel('State', fontsize=50) 
plt.ylabel('Count', fontsize=50)
plt.show()
source.8978ef1c:
plt.figure(figsize=(30,18))
state = store.groupby(['State'])['Sales'].mean().reset_index()
ed=sns.barplot(x = 'State', y='Sales', data=state)
ed.set_xticklabels(ed.get_xticklabels(),rotation=90)
plt.xticks(fontsize=30)
plt.yticks(fontsize=30)
plt.xlabel('State', fontsize=50) 
plt.ylabel('Mean Sales', fontsize=50)
plt.show()
source.c0de2451:
plt.figure(figsize=(30,18))
state1 = store.groupby(['State'])['Profit'].mean().reset_index()
ed=sns.barplot(x = 'State', y='Profit', data=state1)
ed.set_xticklabels(ed.get_xticklabels(),rotation=90)
plt.xticks(fontsize=30)
plt.yticks(fontsize=30)
plt.xlabel('State', fontsize=50) 
plt.ylabel('Mean Profit', fontsize=50)
plt.show()

source.bf7313eb:
# Exploratory Data Analysis -Retail

## By Annapareddy Pardha Saradhi Reddy
source.42077766: In this data set we have details about purchases in a superstore. We are going to draw insights from data by doing exploratory data analysis
source.d78698ba:
### Standard class Ship Mode has highest orders 

### Same Data Ship mode has lowesr number of orders it would be better if we try to increase them by some discount in sevices

### From West Region there are more number of orders and profits are also high in West Region, need to concentrate on south as there are less orders

### Copiers sub-category has highest sales ans has maximum profit from sub-categories,we need to make a plan so that we can increase the sales and profits of other sub-categories also

### Technology Category has highes sales and maximum profit ,need to concentate on Office Supplies category to increase sales

### California State has highest sales but it doesn't have highest profits so we need to make sure that we make considerable profits from this state

### Vermont State has less number of orders but make best average Profit we need to make sure we have more number of orders

### Arizona,Texas,Tennessee,,North Carolina,illinois,Florida,Colorado make sure you do not have loss in these states
